div.div:
Server Fault is a question and answer site for system and network administrators. It's 100% free, no registration required.
Sign up

ol.li: The best answers are voted up and rise to the top

h1.a: Installing optional Nginx modules with apt-get

a.title: This question shows research effort; it is useful and clear
This question does not show any research effort; it is unclear or not useful

div.p: I currently have Nginx installed via the instructions on the Nginx site:

pre.code: nginx=stable sudo su - add-apt-repository ppa:nginx/$nginx apt-get update apt-get install

div.p: I have configured Nginx and it has been running great for a little while. Now, I want to add some custom modules--say, the Upload Progress Module. The instructions for this module say to add --add-module=path/to/nginx_uploadprogress_module to your ./configure command. However, I did not install Nginx from source.

What is the best way to handle this situation? Is it possible to tell APT to compile from source and pass options to ./configure? Can I compile over the existing installation? What about paths--how do I make them match? Or do I have to remove the APT managed version and start over?

a.title: show all edits to this post

td.div: Did you look for the needed module using apt-cache search? – Khaled Jan 27 '11 at 7:29
nginx solid, it not support dynamic module. – alvosu Jan 31 '11 at 0:12

a.title: Use comments to ask for more information or suggest improvements. Avoid answering questions in comments.
expand to show all comments on this post
Answers with the latest activity first
Answers in the order they were provided
Answers with the highest score first

span.title: loading when this answer was accepted...

pre.code: deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/nginx/stable/ubuntu lucid main deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/nginx/stable/ubuntu lucid main

div.p: note: (the previous step may have already been automatically performed on Ubuntu >= 12.04 - also make sure that you change lucid to reflect your version)

a.title: show all edits to this post

td.div: Wonderful, detailed instructions. At the end, while sudo dpkg --install nginx-full_0.8.54-4ppa4~lucid_i386.deb-ing, I'm receiving nginx-full depends on nginx-common (= 0.8.54-4ppa4~lucid); however: Package nginx-common is not installed. However, sudo dpkg --install nginx-common_0.8.54-4ppa4~lucid_all.deb is giving dpkg: error processing nginx-common_0.8.54-4ppa4~lucid_all.deb (--install): trying to overwrite '/usr/share/nginx/www/50x.html', which is also in package nginx 0:0.8.54-4ppa2~lucid. How would you recommend resolving this issue? – Michelle Tilley Jan 29 '11 at 18:44
Remove nginx package: apt-get remove nginx – alvosu Jan 29 '11 at 19:11
In this particular case, is there any advantage to installing in this manner over compiling from source by hand? Thanks again. – Michelle Tilley Jan 29 '11 at 23:28
Hi alvosu, I'm getting this error: dpkg-buildpackage: error: debian/rules build gave error exit status 2. Any idea? – Xavi Colomer Apr 16 '12 at 11:59

div.p: Since squeeze in Debian and since oneric in Ubuntu, there are some (like headers-more-module I needed) in

td.div: Dotdeb provides a nice nginx-extras package: dotdeb.org/instructions – Bergius Dec 13 '12 at 11:00
For nginx-plus version, apt-get install nginx-extras works great, too! Thanks – scaryguy Aug 28 '15 at 2:53

a.title: Use comments to ask for more information or suggest improvements. Avoid comments like “+1” or “thanks”.
expand to show all comments on this post

div.p: Installing Nginx from source is necessary if you want to add extra/(third party module) to it. If installed via source the Nginx can't be used as a service and logrotate doesn't gets setup for Nginx. Follow this method to get it installed with all functionalities which you get from installing via apt-get

a.title: Use comments to ask for more information or suggest improvements. Avoid comments like “+1” or “thanks”.
expand to show all comments on this post

div.p: Sweet article that can be read here will explain the detailed information on compiling modules into nginx. Basically you need to recompile the nginx each time you want to install a module.
Also similar to this method will also work.
div.pre:
wget 'http://nginx.org/download/nginx-1.9.3.tar.gz' tar -xzvf nginx-1.9.3.tar.gz cd nginx-1.9.3/
# Here we assume you would install you nginx under /opt/nginx/. ./configure --prefix=/opt/nginx \ --add-module=/path/to/headers-more-nginx-module make make install
